data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: One of the best Colombian restaurants I have ever eaten at.  The ajiaco is super delicious, the steaks were perfect, large portions not overly priced.  Also had entertainment.  which was really nice.  Very clean, very spacious.

data.title: Inviting spot
data.text: Found this Colombian food spot after a whole day of shopping and we were hungry. I ordered a typical and common Colombian dish called, Bandeja Paisa. The plate includes a serving of thin sliced flank steak, pan seared; red beans; white rice; sweet plantain; and an arepa. Needless to say this is a large plate; however, it was still missing something.  Usually, the plate comes with a fried egg Over the top, but it was completely missing. Anyway, the meal was fairly average and as hungry as i was, I was delighted with the meal. My husband had the breaded pork chop, again fairly average, but he too was just as hungry and therefore, satisfied with his meal. The best part of our meal was the live entertainment of a one man band.  The ambiance was perfect for just having an enjoyable night out in the town. It seems to be family run and the place is very cozy and inviting. Our waitress could have been more helpful with the menu, but she made herself available throughout out time we were there. Prices are average to slightly above average, but once you add the music, it's worth it! We plan to go back again.

data.title: Colombian Restaurant
data.text: Good Colombian Food, like home made. Nice ambiance! The prices are reasonable and the amount of food served is good. The place is clean and the temperature is very comfortable.

data.title: Amazing Colombian Food
data.text:
I am a Colombian living in the U.S. I was with a Brazilian friend visiting Pembroke Pines for a concert. On the way out of town I spotted the Colombian flag and saw this restaurant hidden in a little shopping center. 

The smell as you enter the restaurant makes you salivate and miss your country. We were quickly seated and offered coffee or hot chocolate. We had coffee to wake us up for the drive back home. The coffee was great as expected. 

We ordered Calentados for breakfast. Super filling, delicious and very flavorful. 

The service was quick, efficient and very friendly. 

This place comes highly recommended.

data.title: Good music, food is ok
data.text:
I went with my family to this restaurant looking for a great steak we call "Carne a la Llanera". We also ordered a "Picada", a mixture of different pieces of meat, potatoes, plantains, etc.
They do have live music in the restaurant and this was really good. 
I will say the music was better than the food which It was just ok.

data.title: Real Columbian Food, Great Service
data.text: This is a traditional Colombian restaurant, where you can see the owner through the front window grilling all kinds of meat. It has a pleasant indoor setting that feels like you are outdoors. We enjoyed chicken, fish, empanadas and other items. The server was extremely pleasant. She did not speak English, but we speak Spanish. Would return.

data.title: Very nice family Colombian restaurant
data.text: The personal  is always very attentive and nice. Food is good with reasonable prices. Very large plates. With live music and always nice people. Also very  clean.  The location is convenience and close to a lot of stores and mall.

data.title: BAD FOOD!
data.text: The Place is Very Nice and The COLOMBIAN Live Music too. The Food was bad. I Tried The Worst  Fish dish  IN MY LIFE. so I tried  to changed it  and they said it is  not possible. I hope this help them to improved their food.

data.title: Amazing restaurant
data.text: One of the best Colombian food restaurants in Florida, the bandeja paisa and the carne a la llanera are the best things the ribs are out of the ordinary never had something so good in my life

data.title: Nothing special.
data.text:
The food was cool. Nothing special. Nice decoration. Nice place. Location is very central.
I don't think I will be back.

data.title: Excellent Columbian Restaurant
data.text: By far better than most Colombian places in Pembroke Pines. Superb service as well as food out of this world.

data.title: Delicious Meats
data.text: Rancho Nando is was recommended to me by a friend who is Colombian. She said the food is very authentic. Not knowing what to expect I went to Rancho Nando and ordered items she recommended and they were all delicious. Some of the best food I have had. Steaks were perfectly cooks. Sausages had great flavor and even the rice and beans were good. The prices are great for the amount of food you get and the quality. This place believes in huge portions. They also make a homemade lemonade that is to die for. Try it and you won't be sorry.

data.title: Mother's Day celebration
data.text: I took my mom and my wife to celebrate Mother's Day and the restaurant have great menu and live music. I am highly recommend this restaurant because offering great food and excellent service

data.title: Amazing authentic food!
data.text: You know when you enter a restaurant & everyone is speaking the language of the cuisine that you are in store for authentic food. This is just that place and the food was amazing. We will definitely be back.

data.title: This is an amazing find and a really great restaurant!
data.text:
I agree with all the reviews before mine except the on about the service. It is rare that I go to a restaurant and have such an amazing overall experience. I loved everything about this restaurant. It is just about as perfect in every way as any restaurant could be. This is a restaurant that I believe is true to its Colombian core.

From the moment I entered the restaurant to the time I left, I felt as if I were an honored guest in someones house. They treated me and my family as such and our experience is one I will not soon forget.

I have uploaded pictures of the items we ordered. I chose their special meat plate. I love meats, especially BBQ ribs. I know how difficult it is to get perfect ribs. This place made some of the best ribs I have ever had. From the quality and taste of the meat and seasoning to the tenderness and the perfection of the cooking their ribs, they were perfect. These ribs were ribs I could only dream of ever being able to cook. The freshness of the sausages and wonderful flavors they were able to deliver just added to the greatness of our meal. One of the best things on the sampler was the chicharones (I hope I got this right) fried pork rind fat and meat. It was so buttery and better than some of the best bacon you can find. The regional Latin accents including the potatoes, the plantains and egg pies took me to a place in Columbia I may never physically visit. However, I really felt as if I were there that evening. This Colombian soul food took me there. Look, the meal was just wonderful and perfect in its simplicity. The only sauce they had was some fresh pico de gallo that I used a couple of times. The meat was so good on its own I didn't want anything covering the taste. I recommend this dish to anyone who loves or can appreciate amazing ribs meats and sausage. We ordered this plate for two people and it was plenty for two adults and two children and we took some home. The dish for two, it should also be enough for two hungry meat eaters.

We ordered the fresh fruit drinks, guava and passion fruit. We got it made with water although they did recommend the drinks made with milk. These drinks were very good.

Ok, here is what also made this meal memorable. The way the restaurant is decorated is different from the typical restaurant. Walking in I felt like walking into a restaurant in Columbia although I have never been there. The night we were there, there was live music. The man was singing in Spanish, Spanish ballads and songs. It was a bit loud at first, but we did get used to it. The singing and music added to a wonderful experience. The singer came to the table and talked with us about the restaurant and the food. He also went ahead and promised to sing a few songs in English for us. The music was not intrusive. My family really enjoyed the live music.

The bathrooms were clean.

We really felt special at this restaurant. It is hard for a restaurant to create such a welcoming atmosphere. When we walked in they realized that we did not speak Spanish. They made sure that our waitress spoke English. I'm not sure it mattered as I'm sure I could have gotten by with my rudimentary Spanish and their willingness to accommodate.

I really think this place is a great restaurant and you should support it. However, if you come here, try to appreciate it for what it is. Come thinking you are an invited guest and you will love it even more. This is not for the early bird crowd. Come for a relaxing evening with friends and be prepared to dine for an hour or two.

data.title: Loved It!
data.text: Another great find. This restaurant has it all. Good food,  good service, cozy feel and reasonable prices. I will be back. Two dinners for $28 and leftovers due to generous portions. The red beans were terrific.

data.title: Finally real  "carne a la llanera"
data.text:
Excellent "carne a la llanera" from the pit rack to the plate....It was busy but we had a good service from the staff and its owner Nando, we even took a picture with him!! 
Definitivamente volveremos a este restaurante. Como colombianos sabemos apreciar nuestra sazon!

data.title: Great Colombian food!
data.text: First and foremost, great food! The default language here is Spanish but you won't get any attitude for speaking English. You will love the smell as soon as you open the door. Restaurant can accommodate large parties and typically has large Spanish family gatherings. This is a Spanish soul food kind of place. About $15 a plate but you'll definitely have leftovers. We were the only non-Spanish people there but didn't feel weird about it. Didn't get a chance to try the pastry counter but will make it a point next time.

data.title: Tasty Colombian Food
data.text: Nice place to eat home made Colombian food that is well seasoned and tasty.  Found this place while shopping nearby on Trip Advisor and we will definitely be back.

data.title: Good food! Bad service!
data.text: Need to improve in customer service. Typical colombian, close early, open late because they where open to late the night before! What kind of excuse is that!! We are not in Colombia, run the business!!
